message_2:
If we remove the outlier of 500, the new data set becomes:

{3, 6, 7, 9, 10, 12, 15, 18, 20, 25, 30, 35, 45, 50, 55, 70, 90, 100, 250}

There are now 19 data points. To find the median, we take the middle value when the data is arranged in ascending order. Since there are an odd number of data points, the median will be the value at the position (19+1)/2 = 10th position.

The new median is 25.
